Class Direction_KeyListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • View.Direction_KeyListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    KeyListener, EventListener

    public class Direction_KeyListener
extends Object
implements KeyListener
    methods for working with KeyEvents and calculate direction/speed

    • Method Detail

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e)
        When a key will be pressed, it is necessary to save the status in a separate variable. To work with a variable is easier then with a keyCode or something like that.
        Specified by:
        keyPressed in interface KeyListener

      • keyReleased

        public void keyReleased(KeyEvent e)
        After a key is released, the variable will be set to false or sometimes an event will be started. The sliders will be controlled directly by certain methods to change their values. It should feel like a real gear.
        Specified by:
        keyReleased in interface KeyListener

      • keyTyped

        public void keyTyped(KeyEvent e)
        Specified by:
        keyTyped in interface KeyListener
